1.name: MOP attribute -Advance automatically to day after holiday
1.description: payment will be processed and sent out to clearing. Value date is not effected by this checkbox

2.name: MOP attribute -Advance automatically to day after holiday
2.description: payment value date will rollover to the next business date.

3.name: MT selection
3.description: GPP will send MT103/ MT202 via CHAPS

4.name: MT selection
4.description: GPP will send MT103 via CHAPS

5.name: MT selection
5.description: GPP will send MT103PLS via CHAPS

6.name: MT selection
6.description: GPP will send MT103PLS via CHAPS

7.name: MOP attribute - MOP currency
7.description: CHAPS won’t be selected as MOP

8.name: MOP attribute - MOP currency
8.description: CHAPS will be assessed and might be selected as MOP (depending on additional criteria in MOP selection process)

9.name: MOP attribute - MOP selected by user
9.description: CHAPS can be selected manually as credit MOP

10.name: MOP attribute - MOP Force from schedule Q
10.description: User can force the payment out of schedule Q

11.name: MOP attribute - MOP  FIN copy
11.description: FIN copy name STG is embedded at field 103 at block 3 in the SWIFT message

12.name: MOP FIN copy
12.description: The source MOP is identified by finding a MOP with the same FIN copy service from the message

13.name: MOP attribute - MOP Identifier
13.description: The settlement account of CHAPS will be credited.  In the outgoing SWIFT message that will be sent through CHAPS, block 1 will be populated with the office identifier (BIC).

14.name: MOP attribute - MOP Identifier
14.description: The settlement account of the MOP will be debited

15.name: MOP attribute - ACK/Confirmation
15.description: The message is sent to Complete queue, as no 012/019 is expected

16.name: MOP attribute - ACK/Confirmation
16.description: Message is sent to Wait Confirmation to await 012/019

17.name: MOP attribute - Membership required
17.description: CHAPS will be assessed and might be selected as MOP (depending on additional criteria in MOP selection process)

18.name: MOP attribute - Membership required
18.description: CHAPS won’t be selected as MOP

19.name: MOP attribute -Membership type
19.description: GPP will set the bank as first in credit chain and will send the payment through CHAPS

20.name: MOP attribute -Membership type
20.description: GPP will send the payment to the destination bank via CHAPS

21.name: MOP attribute -Membership -BIC 8
21.description: The search should continue with the first 8 characters of the BIC, and if a membership is found, then the BIC11 is considered as a member of CHAPS

22.name: MOP attribute -Membership -Add member to chain
22.description: The BIC is not added to the credit chain, and only the original, destination bank’s BIC, stays in the message

23.name: Directory Upload
23.description: GPP will be able to select CHAPS as a MOP when bank required to send payments to destination that is a members in CHAPS

24.name: Banking priority
24.description: Set Priority in the payment header

26.name: Cutoff times
26.description: Set the value date for CHAPS payments to the next valid business day as per the GBP calendar

27.name: Missed clearing cutoff
27.description: Send payment to a manual queue with available actions "override' and 'schedule' and have an operator make a decision on the processing of the payment

28.name: MOP attribute -  Cutoff
28.description: Processing time is compared to default clearing cutoff defined in the MOP profile

29.name: MOP attribute -  Cutoff
29.description: Processing time is compared to clearing cutoff selected via rule
